blog.description: Piplup is a good pokemon! 💙Submissions and art always welcome! 💙If you need something tagged, please do not hesitate to ask! 💙This blog is LGBTQ friendly as the owner is bisexual. 💙Mean homophobic and transphobic comments get deleted and blocked, so save your breath 💙 I track ‘today-piplup-says’ ! 💙¡hablo un poco español!💙 (Run by Cass)

blog.name: tired-pokemon-boi
blog.title: It's not a Religion
blog.description:
It's Pokemon.            
Alex. He/Him. This blog only consist of Pokemon content, my fanfiction writing, my art, and so much more!

summary: Pokemon Fanfiction Chapter 7 part 1: Battle Between Friends, Alex vs. Bethany
title: Pokemon Fanfiction Chapter 7 part 1: Battle Between Friends, Alex vs. Bethany
body:
The next afternoon, Alex arrived at the cafeteria with Igneel following behind. He sighed as he watched the small golden lizard look around the lunch room in awe. Igneel had begged to come with, and even though the email said since there was only a few more days before the semester started and you could have your Pokémon out, Alex was still skeptical. Igneel didn’t really follow Alex. It took a lot out of Alex to keep an eye on Igneel, make sure he wasn’t burning something, make sure the lizard wasn’t chewing on something, and to make sure he didn’t wander back into a wooded forest. He shuddered, no more forest fires or near-death experiences. The only time they went to the forest was recently for their training…
He looked around the more packed cafeteria. So many trainers had moved back here, with jackets of all assorted colors and types. Some of the juniors and seniors had their Pokémon out too, some tiny and placed on their lap, some a little bit bigger eating from their bowls placed next to their trainers, and some large near the windows, eating food from outside while their trainers sat from inside on the other side of the glass windows. Everyone looked busy and talking, with a lot of activity going on and prepping. Probably for the tournament that was starting at the end of the week. Alex scanned the area, today was supposed to be the day he and Bethany were supposed to train and share information for this tournament. He looked down to see Igneel looking at his trainer, the look told Alex he was contemplating running towards that horde of larger Pokémon in the corner where the rock type trainers were and try to steal the large rock monsters’ food from under their noses. He sighed again, he wished he could’ve just left food and water and left him at the dorm like he did two days prior. But I guess I need Igneel to train with Bethany, he thought to himself. He groaned, this was turning into a real conundrum.

However, he thought to himself, Igneel could probably take those giant rock Pokemon. He had a wide variety of moves now. Even though those Pokémon had super effective moves they couldn’t use them here in the cafeteria, not to mention the fact that Igneel was just a small Pokemon in comparison to the behemoths that the small lizard was planning on stealing from. Igneel could totally win…

“Hey, BOY! Are you just going to gawk at the rock type trainers or are you going to come eat lunch with me!?”

He blinked as he turned to see Bethany sitting in a table alone waiting for him, her arms crossed.

“You space out a lot, huh?”

Alex looked down, blushed and nodded. Usually Alex spaced out over complex questions that required him to think and interesting topics but now it had gotten worse. Now Alex got really entranced by the idea of certain Pokemon and how to defeat them, especially now with all the information Bethany gave him and his weird over-analyzing brain. Yesterday when she came over and told him he wasn’t being himself about Pokemon battles, which was very true, he now looked at Pokemon and other students differently. Now he overanalyzed every aspect of the Pokemon, rather than just focusing on the idea of type and strength, he focused on size, the trainer’s connection with their Pokemon, terrain, possible move sets to help counter the opponent and his own Pokemon and what he thought was his best option for his Charmander to win. He sighed, he had also spent all day yesterday looking through the student roster, more specially he focused on the juniors and seniors that had their starting Pokemon listed. He was also a little annoyed when he found Wendell’s profile and had found out that Weedle had evolved because of the battle between his Charmander.

The only senior that didn’t have their Pokemon listed however, was Bethany. Since she was a transfer she didn’t have to fill out her information until the semester officially started, which was a good thing for her since she was going to compete in the tournament. It all made sense now why she wouldn’t tell him about her starting Pokemon until she knew for a fact they were going to compete together. Nobody could prepare against her if nobody knew what kind of Pokemon she had yet. His face puckered as he went to sit down with her. It sucked for him because he still didn’t know her starting Pokemon. He wanted to know. Really bad.

As he sat down he noticed that she bought him the same wrap he always got when he came here, he looked at her and she shrugged,

“They asked if I was going to sit with you and I said yeah so they gave me the ‘Alex’s Special’?”

He smiled, those ladies in the cafeteria did know his order by heart. Maybe that was a bad thing. Or not cause then he didn’t have to tell them again. He went into his backpack and took out a small red dish and a small packet of Pokemon food. He poured the food into the bowl and placed it down next to him and motioned Igneel it was time to eat. The small golden Charmander ran over from staring at the Rock Type Trainers and began devouring his dry pelleted food. He looked up at Bethany and raised his eyebrows,

“Is your Pokemon hungry?”

She glared at him and smiled, “I already fed her before I got here,”

She pulled out the small shrunken red and white Pokeball and winked, “But don’t worry when we finish eating and head over to the battlegrounds, you might get to see what my starting Pokemon is.”

He took large bites of wrap. He was so excited that he almost didn’t realize she had said battlegrounds.

He looked up from his wrap and stared at her, “Aren’t we supposed to have a supervisor watch us if we are going to battle?”

She ate part of her wrap and looked back up at him, “Technically yes. But I emailed the Headmistress and she said that as long as we don’t try to kill each other she will allow us into the battlegrounds with the gate code.”

He stopped eating when she said Headmistress. His smiled faded. She was mad at him for what had happened two days ago. Igneel had almost died.

“Hey, don’t worry. Not all Pokémon battles are going to be like the one you just had.” She smiled and then stuck her tongue out at him, “I promise I won’t beat too badly.”

He stuck his tongue out. Girls are mean.

Alex scanned the area, today was supposed to be the day he and Bethany were supposed to train and share information for this tournament. He looked down to see Igneel looking at his trainer, the look told Alex he was contemplating running towards that horde of larger Pokémon in the corner where the rock type trainers were and try to steal the large rock monsters’ food from under their noses. He sighed again, he wished he could’ve just left food and water and left him at the dorm like he did two days prior. But I guess I need Igneel to train with Bethany, he thought to himself. He groaned, this was turning into a real conundrum.

However, he thought to himself, Igneel could probably take those giant rock Pokemon. He had a wide variety of moves now. Even though those Pokémon had super effective moves they couldn’t use them here in the cafeteria, not to mention the fact that Igneel was just a small Pokemon in comparison to the behemoths that the small lizard was planning on stealing from. Igneel could totally win…

“Hey, BOY! Are you just going to gawk at the rock type trainers or are you going to come eat lunch with me!?”

He blinked as he turned to see Bethany sitting in a table alone waiting for him, her arms crossed.

“You space out a lot, huh?”

Alex looked down, blushed and nodded. Usually Alex spaced out over complex questions that required him to think and interesting topics but now it had gotten worse. Now Alex got really entranced by the idea of certain Pokemon and how to defeat them, especially now with all the information Bethany gave him and his weird over-analyzing brain. Yesterday when she came over and told him he wasn’t being himself about Pokemon battles, which was very true, he now looked at Pokemon and other students differently. Now he overanalyzed every aspect of the Pokemon, rather than just focusing on the idea of type and strength, he focused on size, the trainer’s connection with their Pokemon, terrain, possible move sets to help counter the opponent and his own Pokemon and what he thought was his best option for his Charmander to win. He sighed, he had also spent all day yesterday looking through the student roster, more specially he focused on the juniors and seniors that had their starting Pokemon listed. He was also a little annoyed when he found Wendell’s profile and had found out that Weedle had evolved because of the battle between his Charmander.

The only senior that didn’t have their Pokemon listed however, was Bethany. Since she was a transfer she didn’t have to fill out her information until the semester officially started, which was a good thing for her since she was going to compete in the tournament. It all made sense now why she wouldn’t tell him about her starting Pokemon until she knew for a fact they were going to compete together. Nobody could prepare against her if nobody knew what kind of Pokemon she had yet. His face puckered as he went to sit down with her. It sucked for him because he still didn’t know her starting Pokemon. He wanted to know. Really bad.

As he sat down he noticed that she bought him the same wrap he always got when he came here, he looked at her and she shrugged,

“They asked if I was going to sit with you and I said yeah so they gave me the ‘Alex’s Special’?”

He smiled, those ladies in the cafeteria did know his order by heart. Maybe that was a bad thing. Or not cause then he didn’t have to tell them again. He went into his backpack and took out a small red dish and a small packet of Pokemon food. He poured the food into the bowl and placed it down next to him and motioned Igneel it was time to eat. The small golden Charmander ran over from staring at the Rock Type Trainers and began devouring his dry pelleted food. He looked up at Bethany and raised his eyebrows,

“Is your Pokemon hungry?”

She glared at him and smiled, “I already fed her before I got here,”

She pulled out the small shrunken red and white Pokeball and winked, “But don’t worry when we finish eating and head over to the battlegrounds, you might get to see what my starting Pokemon is.”

He took large bites of wrap. He was so excited that he almost didn’t realize she had said battlegrounds.

He looked up from his wrap and stared at her, “Aren’t we supposed to have a supervisor watch us if we are going to battle?”

She ate part of her wrap and looked back up at him, “Technically yes. But I emailed the Headmistress and she said that as long as we don’t try to kill each other she will allow us into the battlegrounds with the gate code.”

He stopped eating when she said Headmistress. His smiled faded. She was mad at him for what had happened two days ago. Igneel had almost died.

“Hey, don’t worry. Not all Pokémon battles are going to be like the one you just had.” She smiled and then stuck her tongue out at him, “I promise I won’t beat too badly.”

He stuck his tongue out. Girls are mean.

blog.name: swainathan
blog.title: Hiker Daniel
blog.description: Commissions: OPEN.  I draw Pokemon and plants.  Sinnoh fan for life.  Drawings that I upload are by me, most of them being pokemon related

summary: So I finally got Let’s Go: Pikachu and I was so taken by the shirts that the youngsters wear (the ones with the weedle icons)...
caption:
So I finally got Let’s Go: Pikachu and I was so taken by the shirts that the youngsters wear (the ones with the weedle icons) that I had to re-make the design into a shirt, as well as a caterpie version as its counterpart!

You can find both of these here on my Redbubble

title: Delcatty - 301
body:
It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.

- Pokemon HeartGold, SoulSilver, X
